position.marginalia_text: in quo primò collocetur Carbo, et coaptetur ei bene, et pos[t] super carbones accensos, substantia distillanda ad spissitud[inem] Vnius digiti, et desuper etia[m] carbones, vsq[ue] ad sumitatem furm[...] et dimittatur operari quovsq[ue] totum dissittetur.

marginalia.translation: In this first, charcoal is applied and joined well to it, and thereafter [...] above inflamed charcoal, the substance must be distilled to the thickness [...]. Of one finger, and even over charcoal, up to the sumit [of the furnace?] and may be abandoned to operate until every part is distilled.

position.marginalia_text: Modus vero alius per cineritiu[m] sic fit. Collocetur substantia in fovea cineritij, ac desuper ligna accensa, et permittatur operari quovsq[ue] tota [...] exeat. Prima aute[m] disti[l]latio major est quam secunda: quia Manica ac[...]te[m] caloris plus infert quam cimeritiu[m]. Fit etiam pe[..]

marginalia.translation: Surely another way through cupellation is thus done. The substance in placed in [...] a pit of ash, and over inflamed wood and is allowed to work until the whole [...] expires. But the first distillation is greater than the second: because the sleeve [...] of heath obtains more than cupellation. It is also done [...].
